data.field: This function tells the thingy referenced by REF that it is now an object in the CLASSNAME package--or the current package if no CLASSNAME is specified, which is often the case. It returns the reference for convenience, because a [perlfunc:bless|bless()] is often the last thing in a constructor. Always use the two-argument version if the function doing the blessing might be inherited by a derived class. See [perlman:perltoot|the perltoot manpage] and [perlman:perlobj|the perlobj manpage] for more about the blessing (and blessings) of objects.
